entry.title: EU rejects Belarus vote result, warns of imminent new sanctions

media:group.media:title: EU rejects Belarus vote result, warns of imminent new sanctions
media:group.media:description:
The European Union has rejected the result of the election in Belarus. Following an emergency meeting, it has announced sanctions against those it deems responsible for suppressing protests, as well as making money available for pro-democracy groups in Belarus. The EU's moves were seen as meddling by the Russian government, which, a day earlier, had warned Germany not to interfere.
Al Jazeera's Nadim Baba reports.

#Belerus #BelarusProtests #Lukashenko

entry.title: Mali coup leaders promise elections after Keita overthrow

media:group.media:title: Mali coup leaders promise elections after Keita overthrow
media:group.media:description:
Malian opposition leader Mahmoud Dicko said he would step back from politics, after meeting soldiers who deposed the president in a coup. The new military rulers have ordered civil servants to return to work, and promised to oversee democratic elections, within a "reasonable timeframe". The international community has condemned Tuesday's coup, with some announcing sanctions.
Al Jazeera's Ahmed Idris reports.

#Mali #MaliCoup #IBK

entry.title: US-Iraq relations: Iraqi PM visits Washington, DC

media:group.media:title: US-Iraq relations: Iraqi PM visits Washington, DC
media:group.media:description:
Iraq's Prime Minister Mustafa al-Kadhimi is in the United States to meet President Donald Trump. They are expected to discuss Iraq's relationship with Iran, the withdrawal of US troops and coordination against the ISIL (ISIS) armed group.
Al Jazeera’s Dorsa Jabbari reports from Baghdad on what is at stake for the Iraqi prime minister during this highly anticipated trip.

#IraqPM #WhiteHouse #MustafaKadhimi

entry.title: Kamala Harris sees US at 'inflexion point' in upcoming elections

media:group.media:title: Kamala Harris sees US at 'inflexion point' in upcoming elections
media:group.media:description:
The Democratic Party has made history by nominating Kamala Harris as its vice presidential candidate, as an array of party leaders laid out their case for Joe Biden to be the next president of the United States and urged people to organise and vote. Democrats must defeat President Donald Trump in the November election or face a chaotic, destructive future amid a deadly pandemic and a rising climate crisis, Harris and a parade of Democrats including women, immigrants and young people warned on the third night of the virtual Democratic National Convention.
Al Jazeera’s Alan Fisher reports from Washington, DC.
- Subscribe to our channel: http://aje.io/AJSubscribe - Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AJEnglish - Find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/aljazeera - Check our website: https://www.aljazeera.com/
#DNC2020 #KamalaHarris #Biden2020

entry.title: Russian opposition leader Navalny poisoned: Spokeswoman

media:group.media:title: Russian opposition leader Navalny poisoned: Spokeswoman
media:group.media:description:
Russian opposition politician Alexei Navalny is in a coma and on a ventilator in ICU in a hospital in Siberia after falling ill from suspected poisoning during a flight, his spokeswoman said on Thursday. She believes poison was mixed into his tea. Navalny is a staunch critic of President Vladimir Putin. Last year, he was taken to hospital after another alleged poisoning, while he was serving a jail sentence for encouraging people to take part in a pro-democracy protest.
To discuss the latest updates, we speak to Aleksandra Stojanovich-Godfroid, a journalist who joins us on Skype from Moscow; later we speak to Dara Macdool, head of Europe and principal Russia analyst at Verisk Maplecroft, a global risk consultancy, who joins us from London.
- Subscribe to our channel: http://aje.io/AJSubscribe - Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AJEnglish - Find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/aljazeera - Check our website: https://www.aljazeera.com/

entry.title: Obama slams Trump's 'reality show' presidency at DNC

media:group.media:title: Obama slams Trump's 'reality show' presidency at DNC
media:group.media:description:
Former US President Barack Obama makes remarks in support of Joe Biden, the Democratic Party's 2020 presidential nominee, during the Democratic National Convention (DNC). In a withering speech to the DNC, Obama accused US President Donald Trump of treating the US presidency like "one more reality show".

entry.title: Kamala Harris to speak at Democratic party's virtual convention

media:group.media:title: Kamala Harris to speak at Democratic party's virtual convention
media:group.media:description:
In the US, the Democratic vice-presidential candidate will speak at the party's virtual convention on Wednesday night. Kamala Harris is expected to focus on her ground-breaking role. She is just the fourth woman to appear on a major party's ballot and also the first woman of colour. Al Jazeera's Patty Culhane reports.

entry.title: China dam faces biggest flood test since opening

media:group.media:title: China dam faces biggest flood test since opening
media:group.media:description:
The Three Gorges Dam in China is facing its biggest test since it opened almost 18 years ago. Record-high river levels are expected on Thursday morning. Southern China has been lashed by weeks of heavy downpours and dozens of people have died or are still missing as a result. Al Jazeera's Katrina Yu reports from Beijing.
- Subscribe to our channel: http://aje.io/AJSubscribe - Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AJEnglish - Find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/aljazeera - Check our website: https://www.aljazeera.com/
#AlJazeeraEnglish #China

entry.title: Philippines faces worst COVID-19 crisis in Southeast Asia

media:group.media:title: Philippines faces worst COVID-19 crisis in Southeast Asia
media:group.media:description:
The Philippines has the highest number of coronavirus infections in Southeast Asia. The government imposed one of the world’s strictest lockdowns which lasted from March until June. The lockdown in the capital, Manila is easing, and many are hoping it will help kickstart economic recovery. But it will be tough - thousands of businesses have closed and millions of people are out of work. Al Jazeera's Jamela Alindogan reports.
- Subscribe to our channel: http://aje.io/AJSubscribe - Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AJEnglish - Find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/aljazeera - Check our website: https://www.aljazeera.com/
#AlJazeeraEnglish #Philippines #Coronavirus

entry.title: Lebanon judge arrests more over Beirut blast

media:group.media:title: Lebanon judge arrests more over Beirut blast
media:group.media:description:
A judge in Lebanon has ordered several arrests over the devastating explosion in Beirut on August 4. The blast killed more than 200 people and left parts of the city in ruins. In total, 25 people are facing charges. But, many are calling for more accountability. Al Jazeera's Zeina Khodr reports.

entry.title: US Postal Service says it will halt changes until after election

media:group.media:title: US Postal Service says it will halt changes until after election
media:group.media:description:
The move comes amid an outcry by Democrats and others that service cuts could slow the handling of mail-in ballots, the use of which is expected to skyrocket for the election as the coronavirus pandemic raises fears of crowds.
Al Jazeera's Andrew Chappelle has more.

entry.title: Coronavirus: What did they get wrong? | Start Here

media:group.media:title: Coronavirus: What did they get wrong? | Start Here
media:group.media:description:
Over eight months after its first international transmission, the pandemic is showing no signs of slowing down. We’ve learned a lot about the virus but there’ve also been mistakes. So why has it been so tough to get our heads around COVID-19? And when are we likely to get the virus under control? Start Here looks back at what went wrong, and what we might expect. #Aljazeeraenglish #News #Coronavirus

entry.title: Mali coup: Soldiers promise to hold new elections

media:group.media:title: Mali coup: Soldiers promise to hold new elections
media:group.media:description:
Soldiers in Mali have forced President Ibrahim Boubacar Keita to resign. Military leaders say they will form a transitional, civilian-led government and organise, what they call, credible elections. The West African regional bloc ECOWAS has condemned the coup. In the coming hours, the UN Security Council will meet to discuss the crisis.
First, Al Jazeera’s Charles Stratford starts our coverage, Later, we will be joined by Ahmed Idris live from neighbouring Abuja to discuss the latest.

#Mali #MaliCoup #IBK

entry.title: US Democrats formally nominate Joe Biden to take on Donald Trump

media:group.media:title: US Democrats formally nominate Joe Biden to take on Donald Trump
media:group.media:description:
The US Democratic Party has formally nominated Former US Vice President Joe Biden as its presidential nominee. It happened on the second night of its national convention, which is being held virtually because of the coronavirus. He will give his acceptance speech in his home state of Delaware on Thursday.
Al Jazeera’s Alan Fisher reports from Washington, DC.

entry.title: How COVID-19 has affected Pakistan’s wedding industry

media:group.media:title: How COVID-19 has affected Pakistan’s wedding industry
media:group.media:description:
Large weddings are a traditional part of life in Pakistan. But the COVID-19 pandemic, and a ban on big public gatherings, means people have had to opt for smaller ceremonies. And that has put a strain on countless businesses relying on weddings, such as florists and caterers.
Al Jazeera’s Zein Basravi has more from Karachi.
- Subscribe to our channel: http://aje.io/AJSubscribe - Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AJEnglish - Find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/aljazeera - Check our website: https://www.aljazeera.com/
#Pakistan #Coronavirus #PakistanWeddings
